CFileDialog

This class is used for open/save file dialogs.

Summary
CFileDialogThis class is used for open/save file dialogs.
Properties
Mode
MultiIf true, multiple files can be selected.
FileMustExistIf true, the dialog requires that the file exists.
PathMustExistIf true, the dialog requires that the path exists.
CreateNewFilePromptIf true, the dialog will ask the user to create a new file if it does not exist.
OverwriteFilePromptIf true, the dialog asks the user to overwrite an existing file.
FollowShortcutsIf true(default), shortcuts are followed.
InitialDirectoryInitial directory of the dialog.
FilenameInitial filename in the filename edit field.
TitleTitle of the dialog window.
FilterFile extension filter.
Functions
__NewCreates the instance but does not show the dialog.
ShowShows a file dialog window.

Properties

Mode

Possible values

  • Open: Shows a dialog to select a file which is opened.
  • Save: Shows a dialog to select a file which is saved.

Multi

If true, multiple files can be selected.

FileMustExist

If true, the dialog requires that the file exists.  Often used to open files.

PathMustExist

If true, the dialog requires that the path exists.

CreateNewFilePrompt

If true, the dialog will ask the user to create a new file if it does not exist.

OverwriteFilePrompt

If true, the dialog asks the user to overwrite an existing file.

FollowShortcuts

If true(default), shortcuts are followed.  Otherwise the shortcut file itself will be used.

InitialDirectory

Initial directory of the dialog.

Filename

Initial filename in the filename edit field.  If the dialog was confirmed, this property contains the selected path & filename.  If multiple files are selected, this property will be an array.

Title

Title of the dialog window.

Filter

File extension filter.  AHK only supports a single user defined entry, but it may have different file extensions.  An example would be “Audio files (.mp3;.wav)”.

Functions

__New

Creates the instance but does not show the dialog.  It can be used to store a configuration of the dialog that can be reused.

Parameters

ModePossible values:
  • Open: Shows a dialog to select a file which is opened.
  • Save: Shows a dialog to select a file which is saved.

Returns

An instance of the CFileDialog class.

Show

Shows a file dialog window.  To show a modal window, set OwnDialogs := 1 for the GUI thread that calls this.  The path & filename of the selected file will be stored under the key “Filename”.  If multiple files are selected, this property will be an array.  Returns: 1 if the user confirmed the selection and pressed OK, 0 if the file selection was cancelled.

This class is used for open/save file dialogs.
